str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

str2: From dia and krino; to separate thoroughly, i.e. to withdraw from, or oppose; figuratively, to discriminate, or hesitate.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To condemn, judge worthy of punishment. From kata and krino; to judge against, i.e. Sentence.
If. From ei and an; a conditional particle; in case that, provided, etc.

str2: Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.
No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
Faith, belief, trust, confidence; fidelity, faithfulness.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.

str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
